arts.ttl: Burnley player ratings vs Sunderland as rare 10/10 handed out for penalty heroics - gallery
arts.sum: James Trafford pulled off two remarkable penalty saves to win Burnley a point in their promotion showdown with Sunderland.

arts.ttl: Unbelievable late penalty drama as Burnley hold Sunderland for draw!
arts.sum: Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship match between Burnley and Sunderland.

arts.ttl: Burnley boss Scott Parker on James Trafford's penalty heroics and 'huge' Sunderland point
arts.sum: Scott Parker admits his Burnley side “owes” James Trafford for his penalty heroics that ensured the Clarets a potentially crucial point against Sunderland.

arts.ttl: Sunderland star breaks down in tears after double penalty nightmare proves costly
arts.sum: BURNLEY 0-0 SUNDERLAND: Wilson Isidor should have handed the Black Cats victory in the top of the table Championship clash at Turf Moor, but ended the night in tears after seeing James Trafford save two late penalties

arts.ttl: Genoa prepare bid for unhappy Burnley winger Tresor
arts.sum: According to Sky Sport Italia, Genoa are ready to make an approach for unhappy Burnley...

arts.ttl: Trafford saves TWO late Isidor pens as Burnley hold Sunderland
arts.sum: James Trafford staggeringly saved two late Wilson Isidor penalties as Burnley held Sunderland to a goalless draw.

arts.ttl: Burnley’s Parker hails ‘special’ Trafford after penalty saves deny Sunderland
arts.sum: James Trafford is a very confident man, unworried about situations nor opponents, as Wilson Isidor found out to his cost. The goalkeeper made two almost identical saves from late penalties to ensure Burnley were not leapfrogged by Sunderland. The goalkeeper’s prowess ensured the rest of the Burnley performance was forgotten as they attempt to grind their way to the Premier League. They still sit second, having failed to overtake Leeds to go top of the table, but have scored a solitary goal in their past four league matches, including three goalless draws. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Burnley 0-0 Sunderland: Long unbeaten run continues thanks to James Trafford's late penalty heroics
arts.sum: James Trafford’s late penalty heroics ensured Burnley’s long-unbeaten run continued following a dramatic promotion showdown with Sunderland.

arts.ttl: James Trafford saves two late Sunderland penalties to earn Burnley a draw
arts.sum: Wilson Isidor wasted two chances to win it from the spot.

arts.ttl: Sunderland looking to sign Westerlo’s record signing despite inconsistent time in Belgium
arts.sum: Het Nieuwsblad are reporting that Sunderland are working on a deal to bring Matija Frigan to the Stadium of Light. The young Croatian has been a transfer target of the…
